original: HEDSTRÖM, Erik Helmer Lars, överingenjör, Stockholm, f Gävle 24/4 99 av fat.v.ordf L H o Hilma Lindberg, gm Aina Södersten. Studex Falun 17, bergsingex KTH 23. Anst Kirun-Luoss gruvAB o Centralgr emiss.AB 23—24, AB Elektr malmletn fr 24, övering fr 31, övering o v. pres Swed Amer Prospecting Corp, New York, fr 30, vkst dir Fyleverken sed. 41. Styr.led El malmletn sed. 34, Sv diamantbergborrn.AB sed. 40. Geol o geof undersökn i Sydafr o Rhodesia mfl länd 24—27, USA, Canada, Mex mfl 27—31, res Amer 34— 35 o 37. IVA GM (39) f betyd insatser betr geofys met f malm- o oljeletn. Av trycket: Ett flert avh o upps i in- o utl tidskr ang geofys undersökn.met.
translated: HEDSTRÖM, Erik Helmer Lars, chief engineer, Stockholm, b. Gävle 24/4 1899, son of former vice chairman L.H. and Hilma Lindberg, m. Aina Södersten. Graduated from Falun 1917, mining engineer from KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) 1923. Employed at Kirun-Luoss mining company and Centralgr emiss.AB (Central Mining Emission Co.) 1923-1924, at AB Elektr malmletn (Electric Ore Milling Co.) from 1924, promoted to chief engineer in 1931. Chief engineer and vice president at Swed Amer Prospecting Corp, New York from 1930, executive director at Fyleverken since 1941. Board member of El malmletn (Electric Ore Milling Co.) since 1934, Sv diamantbergborrn.AB (Swedish Diamond Drilling Co.) since 1940. Geological and geophysical surveys in South Africa and Rhodesia and other countries 1924-1927, USA, Canada, Mexico and others 1927-1931, traveled to America in 1934-1935 and 1937. Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences since 1939 for significant contributions to the geophysical methods for ore and oil exploration. Published numerous articles and papers on geophysical survey methods in both Swedish and foreign journals.

structured.name: Erik Helmer Lars Hedström

worksFor.name: AB Elektr malmletn (Electric Ore Milling Co.)

memberOf.name: Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences

structured.description: Erik Helmer Lars Hedström was a Swedish chief engineer known for his significant contributions to geophysical methods for ore and oil exploration. He was born on April 24, 1899, in Gävle, Sweden. He studied at Falun and graduated in 1917. He later obtained a mining engineering degree from KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1923. Throughout his career, he worked for various organizations such as Kirun-Luoss gruvAB, Centralgr emiss.AB, AB Elektr malmletn, Swed Amer Prospecting Corp, and Fyleverken. He also served on the boards of El malmletn and Sv diamantbergborrn.AB. Erik conducted geological and geophysical surveys in several countries including South Africa, Rhodesia, USA, Canada, Mexico, and more. He traveled to America on multiple occasions and published numerous articles and papers on geophysical survey methods.

career.workplace: AB Elektr malmletn (Electric Ore Milling Co.)
